text: Can I count on order being preserved in a Python tuple?
I've got a list of datetimes from which I want to construct time segments.
In other words, turn [t0, t1, ... tn] into [(t0,t1),(t1,t2),...,(tn-1, tn)].

code:
# start by sorting list of datetimes
mdtimes.sort()
# construct tuples which represent possible start and end dates

# left edges
dtg0 = [x for x in mdtimes]
dtg0.pop()

# right edges
dtg1 = [x for x in mdtimes]
dtg1.reverse()
dtg1.pop()
dtg1.sort()

dtsegs = zip(dtg0,dtg1)
